org.freezedry.persistence.keyvalue.renderers

Class MapRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.freezedry.persistence.keyvalue.renderers.AbstractPersistenceRenderer
      • org.freezedry.persistence.keyvalue.renderers.MapRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Copyable<PersistenceRenderer>, PersistenceRenderer

    public class MapRenderer
extends AbstractPersistenceRenderer
    Renders the subtree of the semantic model that represents a Map. Maps are rendered as the map's persistence name followed by the decorated key. For example, a Map&lt; String, Double > would be persisted in the following format when using the default decorator and settings: 
     Person.friends{"Polly"} = "bird"
 Person.friends{"Sparky"} = "dog"
    or for a more complicated map such as Map&lt; String, Map&lt; String, String > >: 
     Person.groups{"numbers"}{"one"} = "ONE"
 Person.groups{"numbers"}{"two"} = "TWO"
 Person.groups{"numbers"}{"three"} = "THREE"
 Person.groups{"letters"}{"a"} = "AY"
 Person.groups{"letters"}{"b"} = "BEE"

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapRenderer

        public MapRenderer(KeyValueBuilder builder,
           java.lang.String openKey,
           java.lang.String closeKey)
        Constructs a key-value MapRenderer for rendering the key-values for a Map
        Parameters:
        builder - The KeyValueBuilder that makes calls to this renderer. Recall that this is part of a recursive algorithm.
        openKey - The decorator for the key that represents the beginning of the key. For example, if the key is surrounded by "{" and "}", then the openKey would be "{".
        closeKey - The decorator for the key that represents the end of the key. For example, if the key is surrounded by "{" and "}", then the openKey would be "}".

      • MapRenderer

        public MapRenderer(KeyValueBuilder builder)
        Constructs a key-value MapRenderer for renderering the key-values for a Map. Decorates the key with the default decorations.
        Parameters:
        builder - The KeyValueBuilder that makes calls to this renderer. Recall that this is part of a recursive algorithm.

      • buildKeyValuePair

        public void buildKeyValuePair(InfoNode infoNode,
                     java.lang.String key,
                     java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> keyValues,
                     boolean isWithholdPersistName)
        Builds a key-value pair and adds it to the list of key-value pairs. If the InfoNode is compound, then the PersistenceRenderer may refer back to the KeyValueBuilder to build out the compound node.
        Parameters:
        infoNode - The current InfoNode in the semantic model.
        key - The current key. The key is constructed by appending persistence names, which may or may not be decorated, to the current key. In this way it represents a flattening of the semantic model.
        keyValues - The current list of key-value pairs
        isWithholdPersistName - true if the renderer implementation should not append the InfoNode's persistence name to the key.

      • buildInfoNode

        public void buildInfoNode(InfoNode parentNode,
                 java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues)
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceRenderer
        Builds an InfoNode and adds it to the parent node, using the specified list of key-value pairs. Each key in the list of key-value pairs should have its first key-element's group name equal to the persistence name in the parent node.
        Parameters:
        parentNode - The parent InfoNode to which to add the newly created child(ren).
        keyValues - The associated list of key value pairs. Each key in the list of key-value pairs should have its first key-element's group name equal to the persistence name in the parent node.

      • isRenderer

        public boolean isRenderer(java.lang.String keyElement)
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceRenderer
        Returns true if the specified key matches the pattern created by the renderer; false otherwise
        Parameters:
        keyElement - The element of the key to test
        Returns:
        true if the specified key matches the pattern created by the renderer; false otherwise

      • getGroupName

        public java.lang.String getGroupName(java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceRenderer
        Returns the group name for the key. For example, if the key is "people{"test"}[0].Person" then the group name from the MapRenderer will be "people"
        Parameters:
        key - The key from which to extract the group name
        Returns:
        the group name for the key

      • getCopy

        public MapRenderer getCopy()
        Description copied from interface: Copyable
        Creates and returns a copy of the object x that meets the following criteria
        1. The expressions x.getCopy() != x evaluates as true
        2. The expressions x.getCopy().equals( x ) evaluates as true
        3. The expressions x.getCopy().getClass() == x.getClass() evaluates as true
        Returns:
        a copy of the object that meets the above criteria
